description: The Data Privacy Vocabulary [DPV] enables expressing machine-readable metadata about the use and processing of personal data based on legislative requirements such as the General Data Protection Regulation [GDPR]. This document describes the DPV specification along with its data model.
label: Data Privacy Vocabulary

AcademicResearch.description: conduct or assist with research conducted in an academic context e.g. within universities
AcademicResearch.label: Academic Research

ResearchAndDevelopment.description: conduct research and development for new methods, products, or services
ResearchAndDevelopment.label: Research and Development

Accent.description: Information about an linguistic and speech accents.
Accent.label: Accent

Language.description: Information about language and lingual history.
Language.label: Language

Security.description: ensure and enforce security e.g. of data
Security.label: Security

AccessControlMethod.description: Methods which restrict access to a place or resource
AccessControlMethod.label: Access Control Method

TechnicalMeasure.description: Technical measures required/followed when processing data of the declared category
TechnicalMeasure.label: Technical Measure

Acquantaince.description: Information about acquaintainces in a social network.
Acquantaince.label: Acquantaince

SocialNetwork.description: Information about friends or connections expressed as a social network
SocialNetwork.label: Social Network

Acquire.description: to come into possession or control of the data
Acquire.label: Acquire

Obtain.description: to solicit or gather data from someone
Obtain.label: Obtain

Adapt.description: to modify the data, often rewritten into a new form for a new use
Adapt.label: Adapt

Transform.description: to change the form or nature of data
Transform.label: Transform

Advertising.description: Advertising is a subset of Marketing. Advertising by itself does not indicate 'personalisation' i.e. personalised ads.
Advertising.label: Advertising

Marketing.description: carry out marketing i.e. promoting, selling, and distributing a product or service
Marketing.label: Marketing

Align.description: to adjust the data to be in relation to another data
Align.label: Align

Alter.description: to change the data withouth changing it into something else
Alter.label: Alter

Analyse.description: to study or examine the data in detail
Analyse.label: Analyse

Anonymise.description: to irreversibly alter personal data in such a way that a unique data subject can no longer be identified directly or indirectly or in combination with other data
Anonymise.label: Anonymise

Anonymization.description: Alterting personal data irreversibly such that a data subject can no longer be identified directly or indirectly, either by the data controller alone or in collaboration with any other party
Anonymization.label: Anonymization

PseudoAnonymization.description: PseudoAnonmyization or 'pseudonymisation’ means the processing of personal data in such a manner that the personal data can no longer be attributed to a specific data subject without the use of additional information, provided that such additional information is kept separately and is subject to technical and organisational measures to ensure that the personal data are not attributed to an identified or identifiable natural person;
PseudoAnonymization.label: Pseudo-Anonymization

ApartmentOwned.description: Information about apartement(s) owned and its history
ApartmentOwned.label: Apartment Owned

HouseOwned.description: Information about house(s) owned and ownership history.
HouseOwned.label: House Owned

Association.description: Information about associations in a social network with other individuals, groups, or entities e.g. friend of a friend
Association.label: Association

Authenticating.description: Information about authentication and information used for authenticating
Authenticating.label: Authenticating

Internal.description: Informatoin about internal characteristics that cannot be seen or observed
Internal.label: Internal

AuthenticationHistory.description: Information about prior authentication and its outcomes such as login attempts or location.
AuthenticationHistory.label: Authentication History

AuthenticationProtocols.description: Protocols involving validation of identity i.e. authentication of a person or information
AuthenticationProtocols.label: Authentication Protocols

AuthorisationProcedure.description: non-technical authorisation procedures: How is it described on an organisational level, who gets access to the data
AuthorisationProcedure.label: Authorisation Procedure

OrganisationalMeasure.description: Organisational measures required/followed when processing data of the declared category
OrganisationalMeasure.label: Organisational Measure

Authority.description: An authority with the power to create or enforce laws, or determine their compliance.
Authority.label: Authority

LegalEntity.description: A human or non-human that constitute as a legally defined entity
LegalEntity.label: Legal Entity

AutomatedDecisionMaking.description: Processing that involves automated decision making
AutomatedDecisionMaking.label: Automated Decision Making

External.description: Information about external characteristics that can be observed
External.label: External

Biometric.description: Information about biometrics and biometric characteristics.
Biometric.label: Biometric

Identifying.description: Information that uniquely or semi-uniquely identifies an individual or a group
Identifying.label: Identifying

SpecialCategoryPersonalData.description: trade union membership, which is explicitly included in the taxative listing in GDPR Art. 9 (1), is not covered yet.
SpecialCategoryPersonalData.label: Special Category Personal Data

MedicalHealth.description: Information about health, medical conditions or health care
MedicalHealth.label: MedicalHealth

BrowserFingerprint.description: Information about the web browser which is used as a 'fingerprint'
BrowserFingerprint.label: Browser Fingerprint

BrowsingReferral.description: Information about web browsing referrer or referral, which can be based on location, targeted referrals, direct, organic search, social media or actions, campaigns.
BrowsingReferral.label: Browsing Referral

CallLog.description: Information about the calls that an individual has made.
CallLog.label: Call Log

CarOwned.description: Information about cars ownership and ownership history.
CarOwned.label: Car Owned

Ownership.description: Information about ownership and history, including renting, borrowing, possessions.
Ownership.label: Ownership

Certification.description: Certification mechanisms, seals, and marks for the purpose of demonstrating compliance
Certification.label: Certification

CertificationSeal.description: Certifications, seals, and marks indicating compliance to regulations or practices
CertificationSeal.label: Certification and Seal

Character.description: Information about character in the public sphere
Character.label: Character

Child.description: The legality of age defining a child varies by jurisdiction. In addition, 'child' is distinct from a 'minor'. For example, the legal age drinking alcohol can be 21, which makes a person of age 20 a 'minor' in this context. In other cases, 'minor' and 'child' are used interchangeably to refer to a person below some legally defined age.
Child.label: Child

DataSubject.description: The term 'data subject' is specific to the GDPR, but is functionally equivalent to the term 'individual' and the ISO/IEC term 'PII Principle'.
DataSubject.label: Data Subject

CodeOfConduct.description: A set of rules or procedures outlining the norms and practices for conducting activities
CodeOfConduct.label: Code of Conduct

GuidelinesPrinciple.description: Guidelines or Principles regarding processing and operational measures
GuidelinesPrinciple.label: GuidelinesPrinciple

CommercialInterest.description: carry out activities with a commercial interest i.e. of profit or benefit to the Controller
CommercialInterest.label: Commercial Interest

Purpose.description: The purpose of processing personal data
Purpose.label: Purpose

CommercialResearch.description: conduct research in a commercial setting e.g. in a company
CommercialResearch.label: Commercial Research

Communication.description: Information communicated from or to an individual
Communication.label: Communication

Social.description: Information about social aspects such as family, public life, or professional networks.
Social.label: Social

CommunicationForCustomerCare.description: communicate with users via email, phone, sms, chat or push messages regarding your requests.
CommunicationForCustomerCare.label: Communication for Customer Care

CustomerCare.description: provide assistance for customer complaints and satisfaction
CustomerCare.label: Customer Care

CommunicationsMetadata.description: Information about communication metadata in the public sphere
CommunicationsMetadata.label: Communications Metadata

Connection.description: Information about and including connections in a social network
Connection.label: Connection

Consent.description: Consent of the data subject regarding processing of their personal data
Consent.label: Consent

Consultation.description: Consultation is a process of receving feedback, advice, or opinion from an external agency
Consultation.label: Consultation

ConsultationWithAuthority.description: Consultation with an authority or authoritative entity
ConsultationWithAuthority.label: Consultation with Authority

Contact.description: Information about contacts or used for contacting e.g. email address or phone number
Contact.label: Contact

Tracking.description: Information used to track an individual or group e.g. location or email
Tracking.label: Tracking

Context.description: The 'context' or 'scope' of the purpose, e.g. restriction to a certain business sector
Context.label: Context

Contract.description: Contractual terms governing data handling within the data controller
Contract.label: Contract

Copy.description: to produce an exact reprodution of the data
Copy.label: Copy

Processing.description: The processing performed on personal data
Processing.label: Processing

Country.description: Information about country e.g. residence, travel.
Country.label: Country

CreateEventRecommendations.description: create and provide personalised recommendations for events
CreateEventRecommendations.label: Create Event Recommendations

CreateProductRecommendations.description: create product recommendations e.g. suggest similar products
CreateProductRecommendations.label: Create Product Recommendations

Credit.description: Information about reputation with regards to money
Credit.label: Credit

Transactional.description: Information about an purchasing, spending or income
Transactional.label: Transactional

Criminal.description: Information about criminal activity e.g. criminal convictions or jail time
Criminal.label: Criminal

DPIA.description: Top class: Impact Assessment, and DPIA is sub-class
DPIA.label: Data Protection Impact Assessment (DPIA)

ImpactAssessment.description: Calculating or determining the likelihood of impact of an existing or proposed process, which can involve risks or detriments.
ImpactAssessment.label: Impact Assessment

DataController.description: The terms 'Controller' is usually the more common form of indicating a Data Controller. In ISO/IEC the term 'PII Controller' is used.
DataController.label: Data Controller

DataProcessor.description: A ‘processor’ means a natural or legal person, public authority, agency or other body which processes personal data on behalf of the controller.
DataProcessor.label: Data Processor

Recipient.description: A recipient of personal data can be used to indicate any entity that receives personal data. This can be a Third Party, Processor (GDPR), or even a Controller.
Recipient.label: Recipient

DataProtectionAuthority.description: An authority tasked with overseeing legal compliance regarding privacy and data protection laws.
DataProtectionAuthority.label: Data Protection Authority

DataProtectionOfficer.description: An entity within or authorised by an organisation to monitor internal compliance, inform and advise on your data protection obligations and act as a contact point for data subjects and the supervisory authority.
DataProtectionOfficer.label: Data Protection Officer

DataSource.description: Source is direct point of data collection; 'origin' would indicate the original/others points of where the data originates from
DataSource.label: Data Source

DataSubProcessor.description: sub-processor' is a commonly used term similar to 'sub-contractor' and does not have a specific legal definition
DataSubProcessor.label: Data Sub-Processor

DataSubjectRight.description: Based on use of definitions, the notion of 'Data Subject Right' can be equivalent to 'Individual Right' or 'Right of a Person'
DataSubjectRight.label: Data Subject Right

Right.description: A 'right' is a legal, social, or ethical principle of freedom or entitlement which dictate the norms regarding what is allowed or owed.. Rights as a concept encompass a broad area of norms and entities, and are not specific to Individuals or Data Protection / Privacy. For individual specific rights, see dpv:DataSubjectRight
Right.label: Right

DeIdentification.description: Conversion of identifiable personal data (PII) to un-identifiable personal data
DeIdentification.label: De-Identification

Demographic.description: Information about demography and demographic characteristics
Demographic.label: Demographic

Derive.description: to create new derivative data from the original data
Derive.label: Derive

DerivedPersonalData.description: Derived data is data that is obtained or derived from other data.
DerivedPersonalData.label: Derived Personal Data

PersonalDataCategory.description: For a formal legal definition of personal data, see GDPR Art.4-1. An informal definition consists of any data directly or indirectly associated or related to an individual. This definition is equivalent to ISO/IEC definition of Personally Identifiable Information (PII).
PersonalDataCategory.label: Personal Data Category

DesignStandard.description: A set of rules or guidelines outlining criterias for design
DesignStandard.label: Design Standard

Destruct.description: to process data in a way it no longer exists or cannot be repaired
Destruct.label: Destruct

DeviceApplications.description: Information about applications or application-like software on a device.
DeviceApplications.label: Device Applications

DeviceSoftware.description: Information about software on or related to a device.
DeviceSoftware.label: Device Software

DeviceOperatingSystem.description: Information about the operating system (OS) or system software that manages hardware or software resources.
DeviceOperatingSystem.label: Device Operating System

DirectMarketing.description: carry out direct marketing i.e. marketing communicated directly to the individual
DirectMarketing.label: Direct Marketing

DisciplinaryAction.description: Information about disciplinary actions and its history
DisciplinaryAction.label: Disciplinary Action

Professional.description: Information about educational or professional career
Professional.label: Professional

DiscloseByTransmission.description: to disclose data by means of transmission
DiscloseByTransmission.label: Disclose by Transmission

Dislike.description: Information about dislikes or preferences regarding repulsions.
Dislike.label: Dislike

FamilyStructure.description: Information about family and familial structure.
FamilyStructure.label: Family Structure

EmailContent.description: Information about the contents of Emails sent or recevied
EmailContent.label: Email Content

EncryptionInRest.description: Encryption of data when being stored (persistent encryption)
EncryptionInRest.label: Encryption in Rest

PseudonymisationEncryption.description: Technical measures consisting of pseudoanonymization and encryption
PseudonymisationEncryption.label: Pseudonymisation and Encryption

EncryptionInTransfer.description: Encryption of data in transit e.g. when being transferred from one location to another, including sharing
EncryptionInTransfer.label: Encryption in Transfer

Ethnicity.description: Information about ethnic origins and lineage
Ethnicity.label: Ethnicity

hasAddress.description: Specifies address of a legal entity such as street address or pin code
hasAddress.label: has address

EvaluationScoring.description: Processing that involves evaluation and scoring of individuals
EvaluationScoring.label: Evaluation and Scoring

hasAlgorithmicLogic.description: Indicates the logic used  in procdessing such as for automated decision making
hasAlgorithmicLogic.label: has algorithmic logic

hasConsentNotice.description: The actual notice that the Data Subject received to consent to, either a text or link to a document, which should be usable to decide whether the form or consent was compliant to legislation, e.g. documenting how the user has been informed about rights and implications (such as, right to data portability,right to recitffy, right to erasure, right to restrict processing, right to object, rights regarding automated decision making or profiling, processors, third parties, sub-processors, outside-EEA transfers, automated decision-making, or other necessary details of the privacy-policy). Can be TextOrDocumentOrURI.
hasConsentNotice.label: has consent notice

hasConsequences.description: Indicates consequences of processing such as for those for Data Subjects in relation to automated decision making
hasConsequences.label: has consequences

hasContact.description: Specifies contact details of a legal entity such as phone  or email
hasContact.label: has contact

hasContext.description: Indiciates a purpose is restricted to the specified context(s)
hasContext.label: has context

hasDataController.description: Indicates association with a Data Controller.
hasDataController.label: has data controller

hasDataSource.description: Indicates the source or origin of data being processed
hasDataSource.label: has data source

hasDataSubject.description: Indicates association with a specific Data Subject or a group or category of Data Subjects.
hasDataSubject.label: has data subject

Sexual.description: Information about sexuality and sexual history
Sexual.label: Sexual

hasExpiry.description: Generic property specifying when or under which condition(s) the consent will expire
hasExpiry.label: has expiry

Financial.description: Information about finance including monetary characteristics and transactions
Financial.label: Financial

hasExpiryTime.description: Specifies the expiry time or duration for consent
hasExpiryTime.label: has expiry time

Fingerprint.description: Information about fingerprint used for biometric purposes.
Fingerprint.label: Fingerprint

hasHumanInvolvement.description: Human involvement is also relevant to 'human in the loop'
hasHumanInvolvement.label: has human involvement

hasIdentifier.description: Specifies an identifier for the entity such as registeration number or official ID
hasIdentifier.label: has identifier

Friend.description: Information about friends in a social network, including aspects of friendships such as years together or nature of friendship.
Friend.label: Friend

hasLegalBasis.description: Indicates applicability of a Legal Basis.
hasLegalBasis.label: has legal basis

GPSCoordinate.description: Information about location expressed using Global Position System coordinates (GPS)
GPSCoordinate.label: GPS Coordinate

hasName.description: Specifies name of a legal entity
hasName.label: has name

GeneralReputation.description: Information about reputation in the public sphere
GeneralReputation.label: General Reputation

hasPersonalDataCategory.description: Indicates association with a Personal Data Category.
hasPersonalDataCategory.label: has personal data category

Geographic.description: Information about location or based on geography (e.g., home address)
Geographic.label: Geographic

hasProcessing.description: Indicates association with a Processing (of personal data) instance or category.
hasProcessing.label: has processing

GroupMembership.description: Information about groups and memberships included or associated with in a social network
GroupMembership.label: Group Membership

hasProvisionBy.description: Normally this would be the dataSubject, but in some exceptional cases, the consent might be given on behalf by someone else, e.g. parents of minors.
hasProvisionBy.label: has provision by

hasProvisionByJustification.description: This field can be used to proivde a justification why the provision was provided by another DataSubject or legal entity,  e.g. declariing the relationship (parent, guardian), in combination with the field provisionBy
hasProvisionByJustification.label: has provision by justification

hasProvisionMethod.description: Can be used to record information of how consent was provided e.g. by a click to a form, in writing, etc., by logging into a system and confirm per email, or with some additional authentication, etc.
hasProvisionMethod.label: has provision method

hasProvisionTime.description: Specifies the instant in time when consent was given
hasProvisionTime.label: has provision time

hasPurpose.description: Indicates assocation with a Purpose (of processing personal data).
hasPurpose.label: has purpose

Historical.description: Information about historical data related to or relevant regarding history or past events
Historical.label: Historical

hasRecipient.description: Indicates a recipient of personal data.
hasRecipient.label: has recipient

IPAddress.description: Information about the Internet protocol (IP) address of a device
IPAddress.label: IP Address

hasRepresentative.description: Specifies representative of the legal entity
hasRepresentative.label: has representative

OptimisationForController.description: optimise activities and services for the Controller
OptimisationForController.label: Optimisation for Controller

hasSector.description: Indicates the purpose is associated with activities in the indicated (Economic) Sector(s)
hasSector.label: has sector

Income.description: Information about financial income e.g. for individual or household or family
Income.label: Income

hasTechnicalOrganisationalMeasure.description: Indicates use of a Technical or Organisational measure.
hasTechnicalOrganisationalMeasure.label: has technical and organisational measure

hasWithdrawalBy.description: Normally this would be the dataSubject, but in some exceptional cases, the consent might be withdraawn on behalf by someone else, e.g. parents of minors.
hasWithdrawalBy.label: has withdrawal by

IncreaseServiceRobustness.description: improve the robustness and resilience of services
IncreaseServiceRobustness.label: Increase Service Robustness

hasWithdrawalByJustification.description: This field can be used to proivde a justification why the weithdrawal was done by another DataSubject or legal entity, e.g. declariing the relationship (parent, guardian), in combination with the field withdrawalBy
hasWithdrawalByJustification.label: has withdrawal by justification

hasWithdrawalMethod.description: Can be used to record information of how to withdraw consent, e.g. by a click to a form, in writing, etc., by logging into a system and confirm per email, or with some additional authentication, etc.
hasWithdrawalMethod.label: has withdrawal method

InnovativeUseOfNewTechnologies.description: Processing that involves use of innovative and new technologies
InnovativeUseOfNewTechnologies.label: Innovative Use of New Technologies

hasWithdrawalTime.description: Specifies the instant in time when consent was withdrawn
hasWithdrawalTime.label: has withdrawal time

isExplicit.description: The conditions for what is considered 'explicit consent' differ by norms and laws.
isExplicit.label: is explicit

Interaction.description: Information about interactions in the public sphere
Interaction.label: Interaction

measureImplementedBy.description: a generic Property to describe how the measure is implemented
measureImplementedBy.label: measure implemented by

InternalResourceOptimisation.description: optimise internal resources used by the organisation e.g. resource usage
InternalResourceOptimisation.label: Internal Resource Optimisation

LargeScaleProcessing.description: Processing that takes place at large scales
LargeScaleProcessing.label: Large Scale Processing

LegalBasis.description: Legal basis (plural: legal bases) are defined by legislations and regulations, whose applicability is usually restricted to specific jurisdictions.
LegalBasis.label: Legal Basis

LegalCompliance.description: fulfil obligations or requirements towards achieving compliance with law or regulations.
LegalCompliance.label: Legal Compliance

LifeHistory.description: Information about personal history regarding events or activities - including  their occurences that might be directly related or have had an influence (e.g. World War, 9/11)
LifeHistory.label: Life History

Like.description: Information about likes or preferences regarding attractions.
Like.label: Like

LinkClicked.description: Information about the links that an individual has clicked.
LinkClicked.label: LinkClicked

LoanRecord.description: Information about loans, whether applied, provided or rejected, and its history
LoanRecord.label: Loan Record

MACAddress.description: Information about the Media Access Control (MAC) address of a device
MACAddress.label: MAC Address

MakeAvailable.description: to transform or publish data to be used
MakeAvailable.label: Make Available

MaritalStatus.description: Information about marital status and history
MaritalStatus.label: Marital Status

MatchingCombining.description: Processing that involves matching and combining of personal data
MatchingCombining.label: Matching and Combining

Move.description: to move data from one location to another including deleting the original copy
Move.label: Move

Transfer.description: to move data from one place to another
Transfer.label: Transfer

NDA.description: Non-disclosure Agreements e.g. preserving confidentiality of information
NDA.label: Non-Disclosure Agreement (NDA)

Name.description: Information about names associated or used as given name or nickname.
Name.label: Name

NonCommercialResearch.description: conduct research in a non-commercial setting e.g. for a non-profit-organisation (NGO)
NonCommercialResearch.label: Non-Commercial Research

OfficialID.description: Information about an official identifier or identification document
OfficialID.label: Official ID

OptimisationForConsumer.description: optimise activities and services for the consumer or user
OptimisationForConsumer.label: Optimisation for Consumer

OptimiseUserInterface.description: optimise interfaces presented to the user
OptimiseUserInterface.label: Optimise User Interface

TechnicalOrganisationalMeasure.description: The Technical and Organisational measures used.
TechnicalOrganisationalMeasure.label: Technical and Organisational Measure

Organise.description: to organize data for arranging or classifying
Organise.label: Organise

PIA.description: Carrying out an impact assessment regarding privacy risks
PIA.label: Privacy Impact Assessment

PINCode.description: Information about Personal identification number (PIN), which is usually used in the process of authenticating the individual as a user accessing a system.
PINCode.label: PIN Code

Password.description: Information about password used in the process of authenticating the individual as a user accessing a system.
Password.label: Password

PaymentCard.description: Information about payment card such as Credit Card, Debit Card.
PaymentCard.label: Payment Card

PaymentCardExpiry.description: Information about payment card expiry such as a date.
PaymentCardExpiry.label: Payment Card Expiry

PersonalDataHandling.description: A high-level Class to describe 'data handling'. This can consist of personal data being processed for a purpose, involving entities, using technical and organisational, applicable risks, rights, and legal basis.
PersonalDataHandling.label: Personal Data Handling

PersonalisedBenefits.description: personalise benefits received by the user
PersonalisedBenefits.label: Personalised Benefits

Personality.description: Information about personality (e.g., categorization in terms of the Big Five personality traits)
Personality.label: Personality

PhysicalTrait.description: Information about defining traits or features regarding the body.
PhysicalTrait.label: Physical Trait

Picture.description: Information about visual representation or image e.g. profile photo.
Picture.label: Picture

PoliticalAffiliation.description: Information about political affiliation and history
PoliticalAffiliation.label: Political Affiliation

Prescription.description: Information about medical and pharmaceutical prescriptions
Prescription.label: Prescription

PrivacyByDefault.description: Practices regarding selecting appropriate data protection and privacy measures as the 'default' in an activity or service
PrivacyByDefault.label: Privacy by Default

PrivacyByDesign.description: Practices regarding incorporating data protection and privacy in the design of information and services
PrivacyByDesign.label: Privacy by Design

RiskManagementProcedure.description: Data Protection Impact Assessments as per GDPR art 35, other Privacy Impact Assessments, threat severity assessment https://www.cnil.fr/en/privacy-impact-assessment-pia
RiskManagementProcedure.label: Risk Management Procedure

Proclivitie.description: Information about proclivities in a sexual context
Proclivitie.label: Proclivitie

Profiling.description: to create a profile that describes or represents a person
Profiling.label: Profiling

PseudoAnonymise.description: to replace personal identifiable information by artificial identifiers
PseudoAnonymise.label: Pseudo-Anonymise

Purchase.description: Information about purchases such as items bought e.g. grocery or clothing
Purchase.label: Purchase

PurchasesAndSpendingHabit.description: Information about analysis of purchases made and money spent expressed as a habit e.g. monthly shopping trends
PurchasesAndSpendingHabit.label: Purchases and Spending Habit

Race.description: Information about race or recial history.
Race.label: Race

Reference.description: Information about references in the professional context
Reference.label: Reference

RegistrationAuthentication.description: register, authenticate, and identify in context of a service.
RegistrationAuthentication.label: Registration and Authentication

RegularityOfRecertification.description: Policy regarding repetition or renewal of existing certification(s)
RegularityOfRecertification.label: Regularity of Re-certification

Relationship.description: Information about relationships and relationship history.
Relationship.label: Relationship

Religion.description: Information about religion, religious inclinations, and religious history.
Religion.label: Religion

ReligiousBelief.description: Information about religion and religious beliefs.
ReligiousBelief.label: Religious Belief

Representative.description: A representative of a legal entity
Representative.label: Representative

Restrict.description: to apply a restriction on the processsing of specific records
Restrict.label: Restrict

Retina.description: Information about retina and the retinal patterns.
Retina.label: Retina

Retrieve.description: to retrieve data, often in an automated manner
Retrieve.label: Retrieve

Risk.description: Risks can be associated with one or more different concepts such as purpose, processing, personal data, technical or organisational measure.
Risk.label: Risk

RiskMitigationMeasure.description: Measures intended to mitigate, minimise, or prevent risk.
RiskMitigationMeasure.label: Risk Mitigation Measure

RoomNumber.description: Information about location expressed as Room number or similar numbering systems
RoomNumber.label: Room Number

Sale.description: Information about sales e.g. selling of goods or services
Sale.label: Sale

School.description: Information about school such as name of school, conduct, or grades obtained.
School.label: School

Seal.description: A seal or a mark indicating proof of certification to some certification or standard
Seal.label: Seal

SecretText.description: Information about secret text used in the process of authenticating the individual as a user accessing a system, e.g., when recovering a lost password.
SecretText.label: Secret Text

Sector.description: There are various sector codes used commonly to indicate the domain of an organisation or business. Examples include NACE (EU), ISIC (UN), SIC and NAICS (USA).
Sector.label: Sector

SellDataToThirdParties.description: sell data or information to third parties
SellDataToThirdParties.label: Sell Data to Third Parties

SellInsightsFromData.description: sell or commercially provide insights obtained from analysis of data
SellInsightsFromData.label: Sell Insights from Data

ServiceConsumptionBehavior.description: Information about the consumption of a service, e.g. time and duration of consumption.
ServiceConsumptionBehavior.label: Service Consumption Behavior

Share.description: to give data (or a portion of it) to others
Share.label: Share

SingleSignOn.description: Use of credentials or processes that enable using one set of credentials to authenticate multiple contexts.
SingleSignOn.label: Single Sign On

SocialMediaCommunication.description: Information about social media communication, including the communication itself and metadata.
SocialMediaCommunication.label: Social Media Communication

SocialMediaMarketing.description: market through and on social media.
SocialMediaMarketing.label: Social Media

StaffTraining.description: Practices and policies regarding training of staff members
StaffTraining.label: Staff Training

StorageDeletion.description: Deletion or Erasure of data including any deletion guarantees
StorageDeletion.label: Storage Deletion

StorageRestriction.description: Restrictions required or followed regarding storage of data
StorageRestriction.label: Storage Restriction

StorageDuration.description: Duration or temporal entity denoting limitation on storage of personal data
StorageDuration.label: Storage Duration

StorageLocation.description: Location or goespatial scope where the data is stored
StorageLocation.label: Storage Location

StorageRestoration.description: Regularity and temporal span of data restoration/backup mechanisms that guarantee that data is preserved
StorageRestoration.label: Storage Restoration

Store.description: to keep data for future use
Store.label: Store

Structure.description: to arrange data according to a structure
Structure.label: Structure

SystematicMonitoring.description: Processing that involves systematic monitoring of individuals
SystematicMonitoring.label: Systematic Monitoring

TVViewingBehavior.description: Information about TV viewing behavior, such as timestamps of channel change, duration of viewership, content consumed
TVViewingBehavior.label: TV Viewing Behavior

Tax.description: Information about financial tax e.g. tax records or tax due
Tax.label: Tax

ThirdParty.description: A ‘third party’ means a natural or legal person, public authority, agency or body other than the data subject, controller, processor and persons who, under the direct authority of the controller or processor, are authorised to process personal data;
ThirdParty.label: Third Party

Transaction.description: Information about financial transactions e.g. bank transfers
Transaction.label: Transaction

UsageAnalytics.description: calculate, analyse, and report user behaviour and events for a service or product.
UsageAnalytics.label: Analytics

UserInterfacePersonalisation.description: personalise interfaces presented to the user
